Postal Telegraph
GUIDE
New York, May 2 to 8, 1937
Do you know that-
YOUR MOTHER is awaiting
a greeting from you on
MOTHER'S DAY
MAY 9th
And it's so easy to remember
her. Pick up your telephone
and ask for
Postal Telegraph
Fixed Text Greetings Thruout
United States Only 25c
Local Rate 20c
FOR TELEGRAPHIC RESERVATIONS
CALL AT ANY POSTAL TELEGRAPH
OFFICE-IN NEW YORK TELEPHONE
BRYANT 9-1000

NEW
LOW SUMMER RATES
Lowest summer rates in the history of
TWA. Plan a modern flying vacation this
summer. Watch for TWA's announcement
of the mightiest fleet of Super-Skyliners
to begin service about June 1st.

NIGHT LIFE GUIDE
TERRACE RESTAURANT, Hotel New Yorker, repeats
innovation of last summer staging ice show on
a rolling rink of real ice built over the dance
floor. Baptie and
Lamb, world famous figure
skaters put on the Ice Show.
LEON and EDDIE, 33 E. 52nd St., open their New
Spring Revue Monday May 3, headed by Eddie
Davis. Supporting
cast includes Nelson's Boxing
Cats, Haines, Tate and Simpson, sepia rhythm
singers Lane and Carroll, comedy dance team,
Lea Perrin,
strip-tease
delight, and William
Farmer and his Orchestra.
STARLIGHT ROOF, Waldorf Astoria, begins summer
schedule May 6, offering
luncheon daily with
Xerior Sunday, hu in imble, di her daning.
QUEEN MARY CLUB, 40 East 58th St., Mike Larson
and Dan Doyle have added Chic Farmer to their
staff at this delightful club. Joe Webb's Orchestra,
Nancy
Noland
special "Songs and Stuff,"
Durelle Alexander (formerly with Paul Whiteman)
in latest songs, Ray Doyle at the piano.
